flow.descriptionCdata:
041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.1c87d9d5-966a-42dd-aa6c-273a83dca7af.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail 041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.598ce60a-7050-4e06-825a-0a3beeeb6264.description=
Runs a SQL query against an Oracle database, using the information in the tnsnames.ora file.  
The first row is returned on the first run of the operation. Subsequent calls with the same information return the other rows.

Inputs\:
    TNSPath -The path to the folder of the TNS file tnsnames.ora. This path must be accessible by the OO RAS service. For example, if the RAS and the Oracle server are installed on the same Windows system, the TNSPath might look like “C\:\app\Administrator\product\11.1.0\db_1\network\admin”. If the RAS and the Oracle server are on different Windows systems, you can copy the tnsnames.ora file  to the RAS system. The TNSPath might look like “C\:\Program Files\Hewlett-Packard\Operations Orchestration\RAS\Java\Default\webapp\conf” or “C\:\Temp” depending on where you place the .ora file. 
    TNSEntry - The entry name in the tnsnames.ora file that contains the connection information. For example, the value for the TNSEntry input is “TestEntry” if the content in the tnsnames.ora file looks like the following\: 

TestEntry \=
  (DESCRIPTION \=
   (ADDRESS \= (PROTOCOL \= TCP)(HOST \= 16.110.111.111)(PORT \= 1521))
   (CONNECT_DATA \=
     (SERVER \= DEDICATED)
     (SERVICE_NAME \= orcl)
   )
 )

    Username - The username to connect to the Oracle database. 
    Password - The password for the Username.
    Command - The command to execute. 
    Delimiter – The delimiter to use between the columns in the returnResult result.
    Key – The key to use to keep multiple query results distinct.
    timeout - Seconds to wait before timing out the SQL command execution.
Default values\: 0 

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Returned the data returned for each row separated by the value you specified in the Delimiter input (for example, “key16|lst|16”).
    columnNames - The names of the columns returned, separated by the value you specified in the Delimiter input (for example, “MYKEY|NAME|ID”).
    rowsLeft - The number of rows remaining that match the query. 

Responses\:
    more items - More rows are available for retrieval.
    no more items - No more rows are available.
    failure - There was an error executing the command.

Notes\:
1. This operation only supports Oracle. 
2. This operation can only execute the "SELECT" statement. For statements that modify the database, use the TNS Names SQL Command operation.
041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.5c14b1aa-fd10-4366-a9ea-6c2dda539fc2.description=This flow with send an email notifying the Support team that the email notification to the creator failed. Input Values\: vm.requester.email - The email address from the prior step result htmldocument - THe email body text from the prior result 041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.60d623a2-472c-41fa-bed4-9707563885a9.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.95535509-6a2d-4a11-bb40-83dd9d65bdcb.description=
Generate Run URL - Generates an href HTML link that contains a URL to the run history report for the current run.

Inputs\:
    variablename  - The name of the flow variable where the result should be stored.
Default value\: IC_ReportURL
    displaytext - The text to display for the href link. 
Default\: "Run History Report Available Here"

Results\:
    result - The untagged URL to the run report for the current run.
Example (with default values)\: IC_ReportURL ,Run History Report Available Here

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.
041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.cd95d4ab-cd52-46a6-a379-e16cb53a060f.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.description=This flow creates a hostset for the cluster on the 3Par. The main flow collects the cluster name, all server names which belong to the cluster and passes them to the subflow Create Hostset. For each cluster, a dedicated 3Par hostset is created, containing the SAN ports for all cluster nodes. 041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.eae1498f-82b8-4d6e-9435-90a3dec807e1.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 041df7ea-c4c3-4da9-86f7-fd520d15679b.ecd50ab5-7bcb-46fa-99b0-9eb233bf7756.description=
This operation is used to retrieve a value from a list. When the index of an element from a list is known, this operation can be used to extract the element.

Inputs\:
    list - A list to get the value from.
    delimiter - The delimiter that separates values in the list.
Default value\: ','
    index - The index of the value (starting at 0) to retrieve from the list.
Valid values\: an integer, end (for the last element), end-1 (for the second to last element)

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value found at the specified index in the list, if the value specified for the "index" input field is positive and less than the size of the list. Otherwise, it contains the value specified for "index".

Responses\:
     success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
     failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
flow.name: pc_3par_create_hostset

staticBinding.value: SELECT VNAME FROM CCLUSTER WHERE CSASUBSCRIPTIONID='${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID}' AND TYPE='CLU'
